1.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

2.text: Speak to the sons of Israel, and say to them, When ye shall come into the land of your dwellings, which I give to you,

3.text: And ye did a sacrifice to Jehovah, a burnt-offering or a sacrifice to separate a vow, or in willingness, or in your assemblies, to make an odor of sweetness to Jehovah, from the oxen or from the sheep:

4.text: And he bringing near, brought near his offering to Jehovah, a gift of fine flour, the tenth mingled with the fourth of the bin of oil.

5.text: And wine for a libation, the fourth of the hin, thou shalt do upon the burnt-offering or to the sacrifice for the one lamb.

6.text: Or to the ram thou shalt do a gift of fine flour, two tenths mingled with oil, the third of the hin.

7.text: And wine for a libation the third of the hin, thou shalt bring an odor of sweetness to Jehovah.

8.text: And when thou shalt do the son of a cow, a burnt-offering or sacrifice to separate a vow, or peace to Jehovah:

9.text: And he brought upon the son of a cow a gift of fine flour, three tenths mingled with oil, half the bin.

10.text: And wine thou shalt bring for a libation, half the hin, a sacrifice, an odor of sweetness to Jehovah.

11.text: Thus shall it be done to the one bullock or to the one ram, or to the sheep with the lambs, or with the goats.

12.text: According to the number which ye shall do, so shall ye do to the one according to their number.

13.text: Every native shall do thus with these to bring near a sacrifice, an odor of sweetness to Jehovah.

14.text: And when a stranger shall sojourn with you, or whoever in the midst of you for your generations, and he did a sacrifice, an odor of sweetness to Jehovah; as ye shall do, so shall he do.

15.text: One law for you of the assembly, and for the stranger sojourning; a law forever to your generations: as ye, so the stranger shall be before Jehovah.

16.text: One law and one judgment shall be to you, and to the stranger sojourning with you.

17.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

18.text: Speak to the sons of Israel, and say to them, In your going into the land where I bring you there,

19.text: And it was in your eating from the bread of the land, ye shall lift up a lifting up to Jehovah.

20.text: The first of your groats, a cake, shall ye lift up a lifting up; as the lifting up of the threshing floor, so shall ye lift it up.

21.text: From the first of your groats, shall ye give to Jehovah a lifting up, for your generations.

22.text: And when ye shall err, and shall not do all these commands which Jehovah spake to Moses,

23.text: All which Jehovah commanded to you by the hand of Moses from the day which Jehovah commanded, and onward to your generations;

24.text: And it was if from the eyes of the assembly there was done in error, all the assembly did a bullock, the son of a cow, for a burnt-offering, for an odor of sweetness to Jehovah, and its gift and its libation, according to judgment, and one he goat of the goats for sin.

25.text: And the priest expiated for all the assembly of the sons of Israel, and it was forgiven to them; for it is an error; and they brought their offering a sacrifice to Jehovah, and their sin before Jehovah, for their error.

26.text: And it was forgiven to all the assembly of the sons of Israel, and to the stranger sojourning in the midst of them, to all the people in error.

27.text: And if one soul shall sin in error, and he brought a she goat the daughter of a goat, for sin.

28.text: And the priest expiated for the soul erring, in sinning in error before Jehovah, to expiate for him; and it was forgiven to him.

29.text: The native among the sons of Israel, and to the stranger sojourning in the midst of them, one law shall be to you, for doing in error.

30.text: And the soul which shall do with a high hand, from the native, and from the stranger, it reproaches Jehovah, and that soul was cut off from the midst of its people.

31.text: For it despised the word of Jehovah, and broke his command; being cut off, that soul shall be cut off; its iniquity upon it.

32.text: And the sons of Israel shall be in the desert, and they shall find a man gathering wood in the day of the Sabbath.

33.text: And they having found him, will bring him gathering wood to Moses, and to Aaron, and to all the assembly.

34.text: And they will put him in watch, for it was not specified what shall be done to him.

35.text: And Jehovah will say to Moses, Dying, the man shall die: all the assembly stoned him with stones without the camp.

36.text: And all the assembly shall bring him forth without the camp, and they shall stone him with stones, and he shall die; as Jehovah commanded Moses.

37.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

38.text: Speak to the sons of Israel, and say to them, They made to them fringes of flowers upon the wings of their garment for their generations; and they gave upon the fringes of the wing a thread of cerulean purple;

39.text: And it was to you for fringes, and ye saw it, and ye remembered all the commands of Jehovah, and ye did them; and ye shall not seek after your heart, and after your eyes, which ye committed fornication after them.

40.text: So that ye shall remember, and ye did all my commands, and ye were holy to your God.

41.text: I am Jehovah your God who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to be to you for God; I am Jehovah your God.
